decks.notes: The main concept of the deck is to quickly swarm the board with aggressive Human creatures, utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to grow the team and overwhelm the opponent. Support cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls help to protect and efficiently cast the creatures, while disruption from cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to be fast and relentless, putting pressure on the opponent from the start and maintaining a strong board presence to secure victory.

The deck focuses on playing a fast and aggressive game with powerful artifact creatures and equipment. By using cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to boost the strength of creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Etched Champion, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of damage and evasion from cards like Inkmoth Nexus and Vault Skirge. By utilizing the affinity mechanic to reduce the cost of artifact cards, the deck can flood the board with threats early in the game and put pressure on the opponent to keep up.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan through hand disruption and removal spells. By leveraging cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game while deploying threats like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler to apply pressure. Cards like Faithless Looting and Kolaghan's Command help to generate card advantage and maintain a strong board presence. The inclusion of Nahiri, the Harbinger provides additional versatility and reach in the late game.

This deck focuses on using cheap spells and mana acceleration to quickly generate storm count and cast a lethal Grapeshot. The key strategy is to use cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells, while using card draw and search effects to find combo pieces. Gifts Ungiven is used to search for key cards like Grapeshot and Past in Flames. The deck aims to win by casting multiple spells in a turn to increase storm count, eventually leading to a lethal Grapeshot to finish off the opponent.

The main concept of this UR Storm deck is to quickly generate mana, draw cards, and cast spells that allow the player to chain together a large number of spells in a single turn. The deck focuses on using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual to generate mana, alongside Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells. By digging through the deck with cantrips like Opt and Sleight of Hand, the deck aims to find its win condition in Grapeshot or Past in Flames, offering explosive combo potential.

The deck focuses on establishing a resilient and powerful creature through a combination of auras that grant hexproof and additional benefits. By creating an unstoppable threat that cannot be targeted by opponents' spells or abilities, the deck aims to overwhelm and quickly defeat the opponent through aggressive combat damage. With a mix of enchantments that boost power and toughness, as well as protection from targeted removal, the deck seeks to create an insurmountable advantage and emerge victorious in one-on-one battles.

The deck focuses on generating a critical mass of mana quickly through cost-reducing cards like Goblin Electromancer and Baral, Chief of Compliance, as well as rituals like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual. This allows the player to cast multiple spells in one turn and generate a storm count to finish off the opponent with cards like Grapeshot. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection with cards like Serum Visions and Opt to find combo pieces efficiently. The key strategy is to chain together spells and rituals to create a lethal storm turn and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low cost and efficient Human creatures. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and cards like Thalia's Lieutenant to boost the team, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Cards like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Noble Hierarch accelerates the deck's mana curve. The deck's synergy and tribal theme maximize the impact of each creature played, creating a fast and powerful aggro strategy.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays with efficient removal spells and disruption to control the opponent's resources. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence with creatures like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Collective Brutality. The inclusion of Blood Moon further punishes greedy mana bases, while cards like Lingering Souls provide additional value and pressure. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression, disruption, and resource denial.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and drawing cards to assemble the combo pieces needed for a massive Storm count. Cards like Manamorphose, Pyretic Ritual, and Desperate Ritual help ramp up mana, while Baral and Goblin Electromancer reduce the cost of spells. Gifts Ungiven is a key card for finding the combo pieces, and Past in Flames allows for a second chance at casting them from the graveyard. The goal is to eventually cast a Grapeshot for lethal damage once a high Storm count is achieved.

The main idea of this deck is to use a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply constant pressure on the opponent. By maximizing the use of Human creatures and tribal synergies, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and dictate the pace of the game. With cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, along with disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to consistently put the opponent on the back foot and secure victories through aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to deal damage as quickly and efficiently as possible to the opponent. By utilizing a combination of low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures, such as Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize and mount a defense. Additionally, cards like Skullcrack and Boros Charm provide additional utility and help to prevent the opponent from gaining life or disrupting the deck's game plan.

This red aggro deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent by efficiently using burn spells and aggressive creatures. The deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent while maintaining a board presence with hasty creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike help close out games quickly, while cards like Skullcrack and Eidolon of the Great Revel disrupt opposing strategies. Overall, the deck aims to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with fast and efficient damage output.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures. By using cards like Aether Vial and Spreading Seas to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to leverage the tribal synergy of Merfolk creatures to deal damage efficiently. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Master of the Pearl Trident and evasion provided by cards like Lord of Atlantis, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle focused on playing Human tribal creatures. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up all of your Humans, you can quickly build a strong board presence. Cards like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage disrupt your opponent's game plan while cards like Mantis Rider and Champion of the Parish deal significant damage. The flexibility provided by lands like Unclaimed Territory and Cavern of Souls allow for smooth mana fixing and support the Human tribal theme.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate large amounts of colorless mana, enabling powerful plays such as casting massive Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Karn Liberated. The deck also includes removal spells and card draw to control the game and stay ahead of the opponent. Through efficient ramp and strong threats, this deck aims to overpower opponents in the mid to late game and maintain board control to secure victory.
